objnote.p: This pencil drawing is on the verso of a water color drawing, *A Crouching Woman, Possibly Later Used for "The Gates of Paradise"*, Butlin 133 recto.

illustration.illusobjdesc: The drawing on this leaf is difficult to make out due to the lightness of the pencil lines. A seated or reclining figure is faintly visible facing right. This figure appears to be old and male with a long beard and gown. His head is turned up and his mouth may be open. His right arm appears to be bent and at his side or in his lap. Both legs appear to be bent. He may be an ancient bard looking heavenward for inspiration. He sits on what may be a chair, couch, pillows, or clouds.
